CRYSTALIA

Project Name UNDERWATER INSPECTION AND CLEANING
Vessel Name MV CRYSTALIA IMO 9658874
Date July.9th-10th,2025 Location RI ZHAO PORT

青岛海跃潜水工程有限公司
HERO DIVING ENGINEERING CO.,LIMITED
Add:NO.16 LINGHAI ROAD, HUANGDAO DISTRICT, QINGDAO CITY, SHANDONG PROVINCE, 266599,

- 1 -
./ocr_images/cleaning_report_mv_crystalya.pdf/page_1.jpeg

HERO DIVING ENGINEERING CO., LIMITED

UNDERWATER CLEANING REPORT

GENERAL INFORMATION
Vessel Name: CRYSTALIA
Location: RI ZHAO PORT
Vessel Drafts: Fwd 13.0m
Dimensions: LOA 225.0m

Job No: HY-250709
Date: July.9th-10th,2025
Aft 13.0m
Beam 32.0m

Type of Vessel: Bulk Carrier
Reason for diving: Check fouling condition& cleaning
Class of Vessel: LR
Ref documents: IWS Plan
Equip Model: UW430 with 2-ways communicator and underwater cleaning equipments,
KMB-28,Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROV) Cavitating jet cleaner.

Sea Conditions
Sea State: Normal
Current: 0.3m/s

Underwater Visibility: 1.0m
Wind: 2-3 grade

UWI RESULT/水下检查结果:
After UWI,Vessel was partially fouled with different severity at different parts.
BOW&FWD,Rope guard were moderately fouled.
Transducers,ICCP/Anodes,O/B Scuppers,Draft marks,Propeller were slightly fouled.
Vertical side,Rudder,Bilge keels,Flat bottom,,Sea chest gratings,CWT&APT were heavily fouled
No obvious damage to hull plate or painting were found.
THE PARTS WERE CLEANED/水下清理部位:
1/Rudder cleaning.
2/Propeller cleaning.
3/Scuppers,Transducers cleaning.
4/Rope guard cleaning.
5/Sea chest gratings cleaning.
6/Flat bottom cleaning.
7/Bilge keels cleaning.
8/Vertical side cleaning.
9/BOW&FWD cleaning.
10/CWT&APT cleaning.
11/Draft marks cleaning.
12/ICCP/Anodes cleaning.
FINAL RESULT AFTER UW WORK/水下清理后结果:
We carried out UW cleaning as per the Australian Bio fouling requirement and standard (The Craft Risk Management
Stand (CRMS)as following Result after UW work.
WIND & WATERLINE AND FLAT HULL SURFACES
1/Boottop was normally clean.
2/Flat bottom was normally clean.
3/Vertical side was normally clean.
NICHE AREA
Niche area was normally clean,including Propeller,Rudder,sea chest (HSC&LSC&ESC), Scupper, Bilge
keels,CWT&APT, ICCP/Anodes,BOW&FWD,Rope guard,Draft marks.

document_parsing.cleaning_method: Divers with underwater cleaning equipment (UW430, KMB-28) and ROV with cavitating jet cleaner
document_parsing.inspection_equipment: Divers with UW430 camera and ROV with cameras
document_parsing.service_summary: Underwater inspection and cleaning of the hull, propeller, and various appendages.
document_parsing.report_summary: Pre-cleaning observations: The vessel was partially fouled. Bow and forward areas, and rope guard were moderately fouled. Transducers, ICCP system, anodes, overboard scuppers, draft marks, and propeller were slightly fouled. Vertical sides, rudder, bilge keels, flat bottom, sea chest gratings, and CWT & APT were heavily fouled. No obvious damage to hull plate or painting was found. A fishing net and rope were found in the rope guard. Cleaning performed: Rudder, propeller, scuppers, transducers, rope guard, sea chest gratings, flat bottom, bilge keels, vertical sides, bow & forward areas, CWT & APT, draft marks, and ICCP/anodes were cleaned. The fishing net and rope were removed from the rope guard. Post-cleaning results: The boottop, flat bottom, vertical sides, and all niche areas (propeller, rudder, sea chests, scuppers, bilge keels, CWT & APT, ICCP/anodes, bow & forward areas, rope guard, draft marks) were normally clean.

assessment.overall_summary: The provider's report documents a comprehensive cleaning operation with clear before-and-after evidence for major hull areas, which largely supports their claims. However, there are notable discrepancies in niche areas where cleaning appears incomplete (Transducers, ICCP/Anodes) and several sections lack 'before' photos, creating documentation gaps.

part_assessments.agent_observation: The 'before' photos on pages 5-6 confirm heavy fouling. The 'after' photos on pages 7-8 show the rudder is free of marine growth, with only minor paint chipping visible. The cleaning appears thorough.
part_assessments.reasoning: The visual evidence clearly supports the provider's claim of successful cleaning. The before and after conditions match the report's description.

part_assessments.agent_observation: The 'before' photos on page 9 show light fouling. The 'after' photos on pages 10-11 show that while the bulk of fouling is removed, there is still visible surface roughness, discoloration, and some remaining deposits. The finish is not perfectly clean.
part_assessments.reasoning: The provider's claim of 'normally clean' is slightly overstated. The propeller has been cleaned, but the visual evidence shows a less-than-perfect result.

part_assessments.agent_observation: No 'before' photos are provided for the scuppers. The 'after' photos on page 30 show the outlets are clear and free of significant fouling.

part_assessments.agent_observation: No 'before' photos are provided. The 'after' photos on page 43 show transducer surfaces with visible residue and remaining marine growth. They do not appear to be fully cleaned.

part_assessments.reasoning: The visual evidence perfectly corroborates the provider's report, including the removal of specific debris. The cleaning is successful.

part_assessments.agent_observation: The 'before' photos on page 15 confirm heavy fouling. The 'after' photos on pages 16-18 show all sea chest gratings (low, high, emergency) are completely clear of fouling.
part_assessments.reasoning: Excellent before-and-after documentation that fully supports the provider's claim of a successful cleaning.

part_assessments.reasoning: The visual evidence fully supports the provider's claim. The before-and-after photos show a complete and effective cleaning.

part_assessments.agent_observation: No 'before' photos are provided for the bulbous bow. The 'after' photos on page 46 show a generally clean surface, though some scrape marks from the cleaning process are visible.

part_assessments.agent_observation: The 'before' photos on page 44 show heavy fouling on the stern. The 'after' photos on page 45 show the same area is now clean of marine growth.

part_assessments.agent_observation: No 'before' photos are provided. The 'after' photos on pages 19-21 show the draft marks are clean and clearly legible.

part_assessments.agent_observation: No 'before' photos are provided. The 'after' photos on page 29 show inconsistent results. Some anodes appear clean, but others, particularly in the bottom right photo, still have significant deposits or growth on them.

critical_issues: Transducers (Sounders & Speed Logs) show remaining fouling after cleaning (page 43), which could impact sensor accuracy.
ICCP/Anodes show incomplete cleaning (page 29), which may reduce the effectiveness of the cathodic protection system.
Multiple areas lack 'before cleaning' photographs (Scuppers, Transducers, Bow, Draft Marks, ICCP), preventing a complete audit of the work performed.
assessment.notes: The provider's standard of 'normally clean' appears to be inconsistent. While major flat surfaces are cleaned to a high standard, the term is inaccurately applied to several niche areas (e.g., Propeller, Flat Bottom, Transducers, ICCP) where fouling remnants or deposits are still visible.
